acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours EC50=1.87mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 17,000mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-15 (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 2,600mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 2,600mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-15 (2001)) and 3,080mg/kg (PATTY (4th, 1999)).

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on dynamic viscosity, though the substance is a hydrocarbon.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A3 by ACGIH (2001), Group 2B by IARC (1994), Category 2B by Japan Society for Occupational Health.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF=211(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 16degC (c.c.) and the boiling point is 130degC (ICSC (2004)), which is classified as Category 2.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ/somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ/somatic cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, and no positive data on mutagenicity tests in vitro (several indices), described in CERI Hazard Data 2000-15 (2001) and NTP DB (Access on March 2006).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 269degC (ICSC, 2004).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004), DFGOT vol.14 (2000) and ACGIH (7th, 2001): reduction in sperm count/mature follicle count was observed, though no descriptions are available regarding parental toxicity.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on a report on rabbit eye irritation test results (ACGIH (7th, 2001)): "focal corneal necrosis was observed."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on a report on rabbit skin irritation test results (ACGIH (7th, 2001)): "moderately irritating."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "change in WBC and decrease in hemoglobin levels," and the evidence from animal studies including "hyaline droplet degeneration of proximal renal tubules."  The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
